com.ace.lewissketch
Class LewisSketch

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Panel
              java.applet.Applet
                  javax.swing.JApplet
                      com.ace.lewissketch.LewisSketch
All Implemented Interfaces:
LsConstants, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible, RootPaneContainer
public class LewisSketch
extends JApplet
implements LsConstants

The main code for the LewisSketch applet. Suggested code to be placed in HTML document: <applet code="LewisSketch.class" width=510 height=510></applet>

See Also:
Serialized Form

eraseLine

public void eraseLine(Graph graphics,
                      int[] endPoint1,
                      int[] endPoint2)
Draw a white line over a previously drawn colored line to erase it.

Parameters:
graphics - the applet drawing window
endPoint1 - one endpoint of the line
endPoint2 - the other endpoint of the line

eraseGhostLine

void eraseGhostLine(Graph graphics)
Draws a "ghost bond line" while the user is drawing a bond between atoms. Its origin is where the user initially pressed the mouse button and its destination is the current mouse position while being dragged. The ghost line is replaced by a "true bond line" when the bond drawing operation is complete.

Parameters:
graphics - the applet drawing window

redrawGhostLine

void redrawGhostLine(Graph graphics,
                     int[] mouse)
Converts a ghost bond line into a visible one.

Parameters:
graphics - the applet drawing window
mouse - current location of the mouse

eraseAtomName

public void eraseAtomName(Graph graphics,
                          int[] mouse)
Overwrites an atom name with white oval to "erase" it. Constants in fillOval determined experimentally.

Parameters:
graphics - the applet drawing window
mouse - current location of the mouse

displayAtomName

public void displayAtomName(MouseEvent e,
                            boolean isMove)
Draws current atom name on screen. If atom name is moving here from another location, erase the atom name at the previous location.

Parameters:
e - a mouse event
isMove - whether the atom is being moved form another location

changeAtomName

public void changeAtomName(Graph graphics,
                           Atom theAtom,
                           String newName)
Changes the name of an existing atom. Since atom names are different sizes (ex: compare I to Mg), the atom may have to move slightly to accommodate the new size.

Parameters:
graphics - the applet drawing window
theAtom - the atom whose name is changing
newName - the new symbol of the atom

deleteAtom

public void deleteAtom(Graph graphics,
                       Atom deletedAtom)
Deletes an atom from current data and erases it from the drawing canvas.

Parameters:
graphics - the applet drawing window
deletedAtom - the atom being deleted

moveAtom

public void moveAtom(Graph graphics,
                     Atom movedAtom,
                     int[] newMouse)
Moves an atom from one location on the canvas to another. This may cause any bonds of the atom to move, as well as rearrangement of the electrons and charge of the moved atom as well as any atoms to which it is bonded.

Parameters:
graphics - the applet drawing window
movedAtom - the atom being moved
newMouse - the atom's new location

addNewBond

public void addNewBond(Graph graphics,
                       Atom atom1,
                       Atom atom2)
Add and draw a new bond between atom1 and atom2.

Parameters:
graphics - the applet drawing window
atom1 - atom 1
atom2 - atom 2

deleteBond

public void deleteBond(Graph graphics,
                       Bond bond)
Deletes a bond.

Parameters:
graphics - the applet drawing window
bond - the bond to delete

reorientStereoBond

public void reorientStereoBond(Graph graphics,
                               Bond bond)
Changes the direction of a stereo bond.

Parameters:
graphics - the applet drawing window
bond - the bond whose direction to swap

setBondStereo

public void setBondStereo(Graph graphics,
                          Bond bond,
                          int bondStereo)
Changes the stereochemistry of a bond.

Parameters:
graphics - the applet drawing window
bond - the bond whose stereochemistry to change
bondStereo - the new bond stereochemistry

updateBondStrength

public void updateBondStrength(Graph graphics,
                               int clickCount,
                               Bond bond)
Changes the strength of a bond among single/double/triple.

Parameters:
graphics - the applet drawing window
clickCount - the number of clicks
bond - the bond whose strength is being changed

autoCreateBondedPair

public boolean autoCreateBondedPair(Graph graphics,
                                    int[] mouse)
When bond tool is active and user clicks on an empty spot on the canvas, create two carbon atoms with a bond in between. Given coordinates will be middle of the horizontal pair, unless this would conflict with existing atoms. If so, the middle is moved incrementally until an open space (no conflict with existing atoms) is found.

Parameters:
graphics - the applet drawing window
mouse - the place where the mouse was clicked
Returns:
true if the bond was drawn

validAtomCoordinates

public boolean validAtomCoordinates(int[] coords)
Determines if the given atom coordinates are within range so that the atom is completely displayed on the drawing canvas (not off canvas or partially off canvas)

Parameters:
coords - the atom coordinates
Returns:
true if the coordinates are on the drawing canvas
